Lens Objects¶

class lenses.lens.Lens(base)[source]¶

A Python interface to wrap the PVs created by a Beryllium IOC

The methods related to the calculation of the focal plane have two major modes determined by the use_beam. If set to True, the current beam energy will be used to calculate the focal plane of the lens. This is the default mode of operation. However, if there is a need to calculate beam parameters in an offline mode, you can set this to False, and the requested beam energy as specified by the IOC will be used.

focus¶

Return the focal length based on the use_beam parameter

focused_from(z)[source]¶

Return the ray transfer matrix for for a beam of light originating from a beamline position, z, which is then focused by the lens. This is simply the matrix created by the cross product of ray_transfer and the propagation_from()

Parameters:z (float) – The origin of the light ray along the beamline in meters
insert()[source]¶

Place the lens in the beam path

inserted¶

Whether lens is in the beam as determined by the STATE PV

propagation_from(z)[source]¶

Return the ray transfer matrix corresponding to light travelling from a beamline position, z, to the surface of the lens

The matrix takes the form :

\[\begin{split}&[ 1 d ]\ &[ 0 1 ]\end{split}\]
Parameters:z (float) – The origin of the light ray along the beamline in meters
ray_transfer¶

The thin lens ray transfer matrix based on the focal length of the lens

The matrix take the form :

\[\begin{split}&[ 1 0 ]\ &[ -1/f 1 ]\end{split}\]
remove()[source]¶

Remove the lens from the beam path

removed¶

Whether lens is out of the beam as determined by the STATE PV

class lenses.lens.LensArray(*lenses)[source]¶

An object to represent an array of Lenses

The array is initalized by passing each Lens object as a arguement.

The methods related to the calculation of the focal plane have two major modes determined by the use_beam. If set to True, the current beam energy will be used to calculate the focal plane of the lens. This is the default mode of operation. However, if there is a need to calculate beam parameters in an offline mode, you can set this to False, and the requested beam energy as specified by the IOC will be used.

focal_dispersal¶

The dispersion of the beam at the focal plane of the lens array

focal_plane¶

Calculate the focal plane in beamline coordinates of the Lens Array

This solution is derived from the coefficients found in the ray transfer matrix

focus_displacement(z, energy=None, absolute=True)[source]¶

Return the absolute distance from the focal plane to a point on the beamline.

Parameters:
  • z (float) – The beamline position of reference mark in meters
  • energy (float) – (optional) The energy to evaluate the array at in eV
  • absolute (bool) – Choice to return as absolute value or signed value
inserted_lenses¶

A list of all the lenses in the array organized by beamline position

ray_transfer_matrix¶

The ray transfer matrix of all the inserted lenses

This is the matrix formed by tracing a ray originating at the LCLS Undulator (z=0) through each inserted lens in the array

size¶

Number of lenses in the array

spot_size_at(z, energy=None, convergent=True, divergent=True)[source]¶

The size of the spot formed at a beamline position

use_beam¶

The choice to use the current beam energy for focus calculations or the requested energy stored in the IOC
